author: leomeng
body:
My account was locked in today. Posting my positions for the evening crew:

DD $65 10/16 calls 

SABR $7.5 01/2021 calls
 
STM $35 11/20 calls
  
FISV $105 10/16 calls
 
VST $21 01/2021 calls
 
SNAP $25 01/2021 calls  

Have a couple ideas for tomorrow. Have a PINS position for 9/11 which I was hoping will continue squeezing. Want to flip that into something longer dated 

Most of my holdings were beat up last week. I kept averaging down where I could. Had a few wins and kept spreading the $$ around. Stuck with my guns

Edit: I meant SNAP not SPOT

author: leomeng
body:
En Fuego! 

SABR 7.5 01/2021 calls

DD $65 10/16 calls

FISV $105 10/16 calls

STM $35 11/20 calls

Hnnngggghhh

author: leomeng
body: Got in too early on some plays. But followed through and unloaded shares to buy up some calls on the cheap. Got some BX 12/20 calls and more FISV 10/16.

author: leomeng
body:
Oh man. I had 10/16 call options on FISV and PINS that got caught in the Nasdaq dump a couple weeks back. I was badly underwater. Kept averaging down hard. Just unloaded both positions (about $20k worth of options) and all I lost was approx $400 in total. 

Whewwwwwwwwwwww. I’ll take it and wait for a new set up

author: leomeng
body: FISV treating me well. Doubled down on calls yesterday. Hope it sticks

author: KevinMKZ
body:
I'm holding FISV long term.

I don't know much about it but based on growth projections they're undervalued. They've show consistent operating earnings growth too.

author: plasticblock4dayz
body:
I am honestly perplexed at how SQ can be worth as much FISV. FISV is growing twice as fast as SQ and their business is 5x SQ’s. FISV doesn’t have cash app tho so retail doesn’t bid it up like crazy. 

If we’re going to give SQ a 221 P/E and assume it’s not a bubble, at least give give FISV a 200 P/E as well.

author: leomeng
body: Yesterday sucked but today was a twist of the dagger. I basically repositioned trades but at same time regret some of what I did (should’ve kept DD calls instead of averaging down on FISV and BX).

author: ilsamoht
body:
FISV - Management is great, acquires mission critical assets, serves only 1 industry for decades. They are experts.  
AVGO - Like FISV, disciplined, very good at buying and integrating semis. CEO is a beast

author: galaxyfloating
body: American Express, Fiserv, Apple, Disney, Walmart, Johnson and Johnson, Caterpillar, Morningstar, CME Group, Paypal, Visa, MasterCard

author: dumbass_name
body: I’m wary of Square.  The big bank services are starting to push into the market (see FiServ Clover), could cause problems for longevity.

author: KevinMKZ
body:
In addition to those 3 stocks I also have Fiserv which is another fin-tech company.

As you can probably tell fin-tech is my favorite industry, I'm definitely considering trimming my position in Visa and MA because combined they're over 20% of my portfolio.

The ideal scenerio that I'm looking at is to get MA and V down to 15% of my portfolio in the short-term and when I add more capital to my portfolio I focus on other industries such as consumer staples, healthcare, or industrials

author: Jackismyson
body:
Highlights of the Day  
CRM ($278.97) - 7,000 September 11th $290 calls are trading: most bought midday for about $3.90.  
Salesforce has seen repeat bull flow in recent weeks. Shares are starting to move out of a coiled range  
above the $275 level, bullish look on the chart in addition to bullish options positioning. (1-hour chart)…  
MTCH ($113.49) - 3,000 December $115 calls bought throughout the day for about $12.70. Shares have  
pulled back to the 20-EMA and trying to work out of a recent range, constructive setup here…  
Page 2 of 4  
PINS ($38.29) - a block of 10,000 December $32 calls bought for $8.25. Also seeing the October $43/$50  
call spread open 3,100x for $1.12. There has been repeat bull flow...  
 10,500 Oct $34 calls bought on 8/21  
 18,000 Nov $35 calls bought on 8/24  
 10,000 Nov $39 calls bought since 8/7  
 10,350 Dec $32 calls bought on 8/31  
Shares are starting to work out of a multi-week consolidation, bullish look with the stock above the  
$37.25 level…  
RVLV ($21.28) - 4,200 March $20 calls bought throughout the day for about $5.40. This will become the  
largest position in Revolve Group. On the weekly chart, shares have been working out of a post-IPO  
downtrend. Traders are buying plenty of time for shares to trend higher.  
TOL ($43.67) - trader buying calls and selling a put spread...  
 1,800 March 2021 $45 calls bought for $5.75  
 The March $32/$39 put spread is sold to open for $2.25  
Bullish strategy with buying the calls and collecting premium from opening a credit put spread. This also  
follows bullish activity in other home builders like DHI and LEN.  
TWTR ($41.04) - calls are leading puts at a rate of 3:1 today. 2,200 October $42 calls bought throughout  
the day for about $2.25. On 8/26, traders bought about 15,400 November $45 calls. Shares of Twitter  
are near highs of the day, looking to move out of a small range above the 8-EMA.  
Page 3 of 4  
WMT ($147.72) - calls leading puts at a rate of 7:1 today...  
 18,000 September 11th $150 calls have traded for $2.20  
 9,000 October $150 calls have traded for $4.90  
A lot of options activity in Walmart today so I will need to confirm the change in open interest. Last  
Friday, a large position rolled from September to the December $145 calls.  
Notable Trades  
CHWY ($69.27) - 3,500 September $75 calls bought for about $4.00. Shares of Chewy are up 11% here.  
Traders are chasing strength and earnings coming up on 9/10 (those calls will capture earnings).  
COMM ($10.66) - large call buying and constructive chart...  
 2,000 October $10 calls bought for $1.35  
 9,000 November $11 calls bought for $1.25  
Shares of CommScope are trying to work out of a small wedge above the 20-EMA.  
DIA ($285.95) - 4,500 weekly $285 calls bought in the opening 15 minutes for $2.00. Shares of the Dow  
Jones ETF moving higher off the open with short-term call buying.  
FISV ($99.04) - the largest options position is rolling back...  
 31,000 Jan 2022 $115 calls closing for $11.35  
 31,000 Jan 2022 $105 calls bought for $15.50  
Around 8,700 November $100 calls have been bought since 8/21. Shares of Fiserv continue to chop  
sideways.  
GPS ($17.84) - looks like calls are closing and rolling out to open a call spread...  
 18,000 Oct $19 calls closing for $1.23  
 The Dec $20/$25 call spread is opening 10,000x for $1.25  
Strong momentum recently, a move above the $19.25 level would be constructive (weekly chart).  
LEN ($77.89) - trader buying calls and selling a put spread...  
 1,000 Feb 2021 $80 calls bought for $8.19  
 The Feb 2021 $52.50/$70 put spread is sold to open for $3.50  
Similar bullish strategy in TOL earlier - buying calls and collecting premium from opening a credit put  
spread.  
NIO ($19.94) - calls were leading puts at a rate of 3:1 in the opening 20 minutes. 9,000 weekly $20 calls  
traded early for about $0.85. Yesterday, traders bought 2,700 November $19 calls.  
ROKU ($180.06) - 13,000 weekly $185 calls trading in the opening 5 minutes. Shares of Roku jumping 5%  
off the open with traders chasing momentum.  
Page 4 of 4  
SMAR ($58.90) - 5,000 September $60 calls bought this morning for about $2.50. Large activity in  
Smartsheet as shares continue to show strength. Please note that earnings are TOMORROW after the  
close and the stock has already jumped about 40% in the last 3 weeks.  
TSLA ($476.92) - a large position rolling out and up...  
 7,000 Jan 2021 $480 calls closed for $105  
 7,000 Feb 2021 $500 calls bought for $106.25  
Will confirm change in open interest tomorrow. Upcoming catalysts include the Investor Day/battery  
presentation on 9/22 and Q3 deliveries in first week of October.  
Z ($88.46) - 1,000 June 2021 $115 calls bought in a sweep for $9.90. On 8/25, there were 2,000 Jan 2021  
$65 puts sold to buy the $80/100 call spread. Shares of Zillow hitting fresh highs today.

author: moneymoses
body: Anyone have any opinions on fiserv and their clover? I’ve been watching both and I’m definitely more invested in square but anyone feeling fiserv?
